thread.title: Full on-track schedule for 2017 Speedweeks at Daytona International Speedway
thread.title_full: Full on-track schedule for 2017 Speedweeks at Daytona International Speedway

title: Full on-track schedule for 2017 Speedweeks at Daytona International Speedway
text:
Feb 6, 2017 at 10:18a ET 0Shares The Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series is ready to rumble, with Daytona Speedweeks almost here and two full weekends of racing nearly upon us. All three of NASCAR’s national touring series will be in action at the world center of speed. Following is the on-track schedule for NASCAR activity from Daytona International Speedway for this year’s Speedweeks. All times are ET. Getty Images Jerry Markland Friday, February 17 The first on-track activity for the 2017 NASCAR season begins with two rounds of practice for the Advance Auto Parts Clash. The Cup drivers will be on track from 5-5:55 p.m. in the first session, with the final Happy Hour round from 6:30-7:25 p.m. Live television coverage will be on FS1. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Saturday, February 18 The first two Daytona 500 practices kick off the day. The first is from 12:30-1:25 p.m., with the second from 2:30-3:25 p.m. At 8 p.m., the Advance Auto Parts Clash takes place. The race is 75 laps, 187.50 miles. Live television coverage will be on FS1. © F. Peirce Williams Thursday, February 23 
The pace picks up, starting with a practice that runs from noon-12:55 p.m. for the cars in the first Duel 150 qualifying race. That’s immediately followed by a practice from 1-1:55 p.m. for cars in the second Duel. 
From 2-2:55 p.m., the NASCAR Camping World Truck Series has its first practice, with Happy Hour from 4-4:55 p.m. 
The first Duel 150 is set for 7 p.m., with the second one taking place at 9 p.m. Each Duel is 60 laps, 150 miles. 
All live television coverage will be on FS1. Getty Images Getty Images Thursday, February 23 
The pace picks up, starting with a practice that runs from noon-12:55 p.m. for the cars in the first Duel 150 qualifying race. That’s immediately followed by a practice from 1-1:55 p.m. for cars in the second Duel. 
From 2-2:55 p.m., the NASCAR Camping World Truck Series has its first practice, with Happy Hour from 4-4:55 p.m. 
The first Duel 150 is set for 7 p.m., with the second one taking place at 9 p.m. Each Duel is 60 laps, 150 miles. 
All live television coverage will be on FS1. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Friday, February 24 
Another busy day begins with NASCAR XFINITY Series practice from noon-12:55 p.m. Then it’s the first Daytona 500 practice from 1-1:55 p.m., followed by XFINITY Happy Hour from 2-2:55 p.m. and another round of Daytona 500 practice from 3-3:55 p.m. 
The NASCAR Camping World Truck Series then takes the stage, with qualifying for the NextEra Energy Resources 250 at 4:30 p.m. and the race at 7:30 p.m. All live television coverage will be on FS1. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Saturday, February 25 
The NASCAR XFINITY Series qualifies at 10:30 a.m. and races at 3:30 p.m. with the running of the Power Shares QQQ 300. 
The final Daytona 500 Happy Hour round of practice takes place from 1-1:55 p.m. Once again, all the live television coverage of the day’s on-track activity will be on FS1. Getty Images Getty Images Sunday, February 26 The Daytona 500 rolls off at 2 p.m. ET on FOX, with pre-race coverage beginning at 1 p.m. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images
